Returns:
an empty Iteration

unique

public static <T,E extends java.lang.Exception> Iteration<T,E> unique(Iteration<T,E> theIteration)
                                                         throws E extends java.lang.Exception
Filters any duplicated values from the Iteration. This keeps a copy of the values it has already seen, so there is additional memory overhead for computing which values are unique. Values in the iteration should correctly implement hashCode & equals otherwise the results of invoking this method are not guaranteed.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the value
E - the type of exception that can be thrown
Parameters:
theIteration - the iteration to filter duplicated values from
Returns:
a unique iteration
Throws:
E - if there was an error while computing the result.
E extends java.lang.Exception

concat

public static <T,E extends java.lang.Exception> Iteration<T,E> concat(java.lang.Iterable<Iteration<T,E>> theIterations)
Combines multiple Iterations into a single Iteration.

Type Parameters:
T - the result type
E - the exception that can be thrown during use
Parameters:
theIterations - the iterations to concat
Returns:
a concatenated iteration which will iterate over all the provided Iterations

closeQuietly

public static void closeQuietly(Iteration<?,?> theIteration)
Quietly close the iteration and swallow any errors that result from closing

Parameters:
theIteration - the iteration to close

toIterator

public static <T,E extends java.lang.Throwable> java.util.Iterator<T> toIterator(Iteration<T,E> theIteration)
Wrap an adapater around the Iteration so it can be used as a standard java Iterator. Exceptions are thrown unchecked as RuntimeExceptions. If you use this class, it is recommended that you catch RuntimeExceptions and rethrow it's cause as the type exposed by the Iteration. The adapter does not close the Iteration when it is done with it, so the caller is responsible for closing the original iteration to free up its resources.

Type Parameters:
T - the return type
E - the error type thrown by the iteration
Parameters:
theIteration - the iteration
Returns:
an Iterator wrapping the iteration.

toIteration

public static <T,E extends java.lang.Exception> Iteration<T,E> toIteration(java.util.Iterator<T> theIterator)
Create a Iteration backed by a standard Java Iterator

Type Parameters:
T - the return type
Parameters:
theIterator - the base iterator
Returns:
an Iteration backed by the Iterator

all

public static <T,E extends java.lang.Throwable> Iteration<T,E> all(java.lang.Iterable<Iteration<T,E>> theIterations)
Create an Iteration that is the union of all the provided iterations

Type Parameters:
T - the return type
E - the error type
Parameters:
theIterations - the child iteratinos
Returns:
an Iteration that will iterate over the contents of all the provided iterations

set

public static <T,E extends java.lang.Throwable> java.util.Set<T> set(Iteration<T,E> theIteration)
                            throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
Return the contents of the Iteration as a Set. The Iteration is closed when the method returns.

Type Parameters:
T - the type returned by the iteration
E - the exception thrown by the iteration
Parameters:
theIteration - the iteration
Returns:
the contents of the iteration as a set
Throws:
E - if there is an error getting the elements from the iteration
E extends java.lang.Throwable

equals

public static <T,E extends java.lang.Throwable> boolean equals(Iteration<T,E> theLeftIter,
                                                               Iteration<T,E> theRightIter)
                      throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
Return whether or not the Iterations have the same contents. Does not compare implementation. null's are considered equals, otherwise Object.equals is used. Iterations are not closed.

Parameters:
theLeftIter - an iteration
theRightIter - the iteration to compare to
Returns:
true if the iterations have the same exact contents, false otherwise.
Throws:
E - if one of the iterations threw something while comparing
E extends java.lang.Throwable

list

public static <T,E extends java.lang.Throwable> java.util.List<T> list(Iteration<T,E> theIteration)
                              throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
Return the contents of the Iteration as a List. The Iteration is closed when the method returns.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the iteration
E - the error type of the iteration
Parameters:
theIteration - the iteration
Returns:
the contents of the iteration as a list
Throws:
E - if there is an error getting the elements from the Iteration
E extends java.lang.Throwable

each

public static <T,E extends java.lang.Throwable> void each(Iteration<T,E> theIteration,
                                                          Predicate<T> thePred)
                 throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
Apply the provided predicate to each element in the Iteration. The Iteration is closed when the method returns.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the iteration
E - the error type of the iteration
Parameters:
theIteration - the iteration
thePred - the predicate to apply
Throws:
E - if there is an error while iterating
E extends java.lang.Throwable

filter

public static <T,E extends java.lang.Throwable> Iteration<T,E> filter(Iteration<T,E> theIteration,
                                                                      Predicate<T> thePred)
                                                         throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
Return a new iteration which is a filtered view of the original iteration. The original iteration will be exhausted by this process

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the iteration
E - the error type
Parameters:
theIteration - the iteration
thePred - the predicate to use for filtering
Returns:
a filtered view of the original iteration
Throws:
E - if there is an error while iterating
E extends java.lang.Throwable

transform

                                                                           Function<I,O> theFunc)
                                                            throws E extends java.lang.Throwable
Apply the function to the results of the Iteration and return a new Iteration with the transformed results

Type Parameters:
I - the input type
O - the output type
E - the error type
Parameters:
theIteration - the iteration
theFunc - the transforming function
Returns:
the transformed iteration
Throws:
E - if there is an error while iterating
E extends java.lang.Throwable

size

public static <E extends java.lang.Exception> int size(Iteration<?,E> theIteration)
                throws E extends java.lang.Exception
Return the size of the iteration. The iteration will be exhausted (and closed) when this method returns.

Type Parameters:
E - the type of exception thrown
Parameters:
theIteration - the iteration whose size we are to retrieve
Returns:
the number of elements in the iteration
Throws:
E - if there is an error while iterating
E extends java.lang.Exception

Type Parameters:

E - the exception
Parameters:
